nullableString.title: Nullable string
nullableString.description: A text format that may have no value.

stringInteger.title: String integer
stringInteger.description: An integer value in string format.

ncbiTaxonomyId.title: NCBI Taxonomy identifier
ncbiTaxonomyId.description: A non-zero integer that represents the NCBI Taxonomy identifier for an organism.

dateTime.title: Date and time
dateTime.description: A date and time in RFC 3339 format, separated by a space.

nullableDateTime.title: Nullable date-time
nullableDateTime.description: A date-time format that may have no value.

sessionKey.title: Curation session key
sessionKey.description: A unique identifier for Canto curation sessions, in hexadecimal format; used in curation session URLs. Note that 8-character identifiers are a legacy format.

alleleId.title: Allele identifier
alleleId.description: A unique identifier for an allele, which combines 1) the unique name property for the gene, 2) the curation session identifier for the session containing the allele, and 3) a sequentially incremented number.

genotypeId.title: Genotype identifier
genotypeId.description: A unique identifier for a genotype. Wild-type genotypes (containing no alleles) have a different identifier format from mutant genotypes (which contain one or more alleles).

mutantGenotypeId.title: Mutant genotype identifier
mutantGenotypeId.description: A unique identifier for a mutant genotype. A mutant genotype is a genotype that contains one or more alleles. The identifier consists of: 1) the curation session identifier, 2) the string '-genotype-', and 3) a sequentially incremented integer.

wildTypeGenotypeId.title: Wild-type genotype identifier
wildTypeGenotypeId.description: A unique identifier for a wild-type genotype. A wild-type genotype is a genotype that contains no alleles. The identifier consists of: 1) the species name, 2) the string 'wild-type-genotype', and 3) the strain name of the species.

metagenotypeId.title: Metagenotype identifier
metagenotypeId.description: A unique identifer for a metagenotype, consisting of 1) the curation session identifier, 2) the string '-metagenotype-', and 3) a sequentially incremented integer.

curation_sessions.title: Curation sessions
curation_sessions.description: A collection of all curation sessions exported by Canto, keyed by their session ID.

.+.title: Curation session
.+.description: An object containing all the data curated in one curation session.

alleles.title: Alleles
alleles.description: A collection of all alleles in the curation session, keyed by their allele identifier.

.+.title: Allele
.+.description: A single allele; a mutation, or set of mutations, in one copy of a gene at one locus.

allele_type.title: Allele type
allele_type.description: The type of mutation (or mutations) for the allele.

gene.title: Allele gene
gene.description: An identifier for the gene corresponding to the allele. May contain the scientific name for the organism corresponding to the gene, if Canto is in multi-organism mode.

name.title: Allele name
name.description: The name for the allele. This may be specified by the user, or automatically generated by Canto.

primary_identifier.title: Primary identifier
primary_identifier.description: The primary identifier for the allele. Usually equivalent to the allele identifier.

synonyms.title: Allele synonyms
synonyms.description: A collection of synonyms of the allele name.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: A collection of all annotations from the curation session.

conditions.title: Experimental conditions
conditions.description: A collection of experimental conditions for the annotation.

creation_date.title: Creation date
creation_date.description: The date when the annotation was created.

curator.title: Annotation curator
curator.description: The curator who created the annotation.

community_curated.title: Community curated
community_curated.description: `true` if the curator who created the annotation was a community curator (not a member of the admin curation team), otherwise `false`.

email.title: Annotation curator email
email.description: The email address of the curator who created the annotation.

name.title: Annotation curator name
name.description: The name of the curator who created the annotation.

evidence_code.title: Experimental evidence code
evidence_code.description: An evidence code or experimental technique related to the annotation. In the case of Gene Ontology annotations, this code should be a GO Experimental Evidence Code. Note that these codes may be freely configured by Canto admins.

extension.title: Annotation extensions
extension.description: A collection of annotation extensions on the annotation.

items.title: Annotation extension
items.description: An annotation extension is a binary relation with a ontology term as its domain, and a range of one of the following: an ontology term ID; an annotated feature in the curation session (gene, genotype, etc.); or a literal value (a number or a string).

rangeDisplayName.title: Extension range display name
rangeDisplayName.description: A display name for the range of the annotation extension relation. For ontology terms, the display name is the name of the term; for annotated features, the display name is the name of the feature; otherwise, the display name is blank.

rangeType.title: Extension range type
rangeType.description: The type of the range of the annotation extension relation. Note that this may be absent in the case that an admin curator has entered the relation as text.

rangeValue.title: Extension range value
rangeValue.description: The value of the range of an annotation extension relation. For ontology terms, the value is the OBO ID of the term; for annotated features, the value is the unique identifier of the feature; for literals, the value is the value of the literal.

relation.title: Extension relation name
relation.description: The name of the annotation extension relation, loaded from the annotation extension configuration file.

gene.title: Annotation gene
gene.description: The identifier of the gene annotated by the annotation.

genotype.title: Annotation genotype
genotype.description: The identifier of the genotype annotated by the annotation.

metagenotype.title: Annotation metagenotype
metagenotype.description: The identifier of the metagenotype annotated by the annotation.

publication.title: Annotation publication
publication.description: The PubMed ID for the publication corresponding to the curation session containing this annotation.

submitter_comment.title: Submitter comment
submitter_comment.description: A comment from the curator who created the annotation, usually describing information that cannot be captured elsewhere in the annotation.

term.title: Annotation ontology term
term.description: The OBO ID of the ontology term used in the annotation.

term_suggestion.title: Term suggestion
term_suggestion.description: A suggestion for a term to be added to the relevant ontology for the annotation. Used when no suitable term exists for the annotation being made.

definition.title: Suggested term definition
definition.description: The term definition for the suggested term.

name.title: Suggested term name
name.description: The term name for the suggested term.

type.title: Annotation type
type.description: The type of the annotation; usually equivalent to the OBO namespace of the ontology term used in the annotation.

genes.title: Genes
genes.description: A collection of all genes from the curation session.

organism.title: Gene organism name
organism.description: The scientific name of the organism corresponding to the gene.

uniquename.title: Gene unique name
uniquename.description: A unique name for the gene; usually a systematic identifier from a biological database.

genotypes.title: Genotypes
genotypes.description: A collection of all genotypes from the curation session, keyed by their genotype identifier.

.+.title: Genotype
.+.description: A genotype of an organism of a specific strain. Contains one or more loci, and one or more alleles at each locus.

background.title: Genotype background
background.description: Background details about a genotype, such as the mating type of the organism, or reporter genes.

comment.title: Genotype comments
comment.description: Comments entered by the curator to describe information that is out of scope of current genotype curation.

loci.title: Genotype loci
loci.description: A collection of loci corresponding to the alleles in the genotype.

items.title: Genotype locus
items.description: A collection representing a locus containing one or more alleles. Multiple alleles are present in the case of diploid or polyploid organisms.

items.title: Genotype allele
items.description: An allele of a gene in the genotype; specifically a reference to the ID of that allele.

expression.title: Gene expression level
expression.description: A qualitative term describing the level of gene expression in the allele.

name.title: Genotype name
name.description: A name for the genotype specified by the curator.

organism_strain.title: Genotype organism strain
organism_strain.description: The strain name of the organism corresponding to the genotype.

organism_taxonid.title: Genotype taxonomic identifier
organism_taxonid.description: The NCBI Taxonomy ID of the organism corresponding to the genotype.

accepted_timestamp.title: Accepted date
accepted_timestamp.description: The date and time on which the curation session was accepted by an admin curator.

admin_session.title: Admin session
admin_session.description: Boolean string that tracks whether the curation session is in admin mode. For internal use only.

annotation_mode.title: Annotation mode
annotation_mode.description: Tracks the annotation mode of the curation session in Canto. For internal use only.

annotation_status.title: Annotation status
annotation_status.description: A categorical term that tracks the current state (and relative progress) of a curation session.

annotation_status_datestamp.title: Annotation status date
annotation_status_datestamp.description: The date and time when the annotation status was last changed.

approval_in_progress_timestamp.title: Approval in progress date
approval_in_progress_timestamp.description: The date and time when the annotation status was set to 'APPROVAL_IN_PROGRESS'.

canto_session.title: Canto session ID
canto_session.description: The session identifier for this curation session.

curation_in_progress_timestamp.title: Curation in progress date
curation_in_progress_timestamp.description: The date and time when the annotation status was set to 'CURATION_IN_PROGRESS'.

curation_pub_id.title: Curation session PubMed ID
curation_pub_id.description: The PubMed identifier for the publication corresponding to the curation session.

curator_name.title: Curator name
curator_name.description: The name of the current curator of the curation session.

curator_role.title: Curator role
curator_role.description: The role of the current curator of the curation session; specifically whether they are an admin curator or a community curator.

initial_curator_name.title: Initial curator name
initial_curator_name.description: The name of of the curator that created the curation session.

message_for_curators.title: Message for admin curators
message_for_curators.description: A message from the current curator to the team of admin curators, usually detailing additional information that could not be captured in the curation session.

needs_approval_timestamp.title: Needs approval date
needs_approval_timestamp.description: The date and time when the annotation status was set to 'NEEDS_APPROVAL'.

reactivated_timestamp.title: Reactivated date
reactivated_timestamp.description: The date and time when the curation session was reactivated (after being paused).

session_created_timestamp.title: Session creation date
session_created_timestamp.description: The date and time when the curation session was first created.

session_first_submitted_timestamp.title: Session submission date
session_first_submitted_timestamp.description: The date and time when the curation session was first submitted for approval.

session_genes_count.title: Session gene count
session_genes_count.description: The number of genes in the curation session.

session_reactivated_timestamp.title: Reactivated date
session_reactivated_timestamp.description: The date and time when the curation session was reactivated (after being paused).

session_term_suggestions_count.title: Term suggestion count
session_term_suggestions_count.description: The number of term suggestions in the curation session.

session_unknown_conditions_count.title: Unknown conditions count
session_unknown_conditions_count.description: The number of experimental conditions in the session that are not found in the experimental conditions ontology.

term_suggestion_count.title: Term suggestion count
term_suggestion_count.description: The number of term suggestions in the curation session.

unknown_conditions_count.title: Unknown conditions count
unknown_conditions_count.description: The number of experimental conditions in the session that are not found in the experimental conditions ontology.

metagenotypes.title: Metagenotypes
metagenotypes.description: A collection of metagenotypes curated in the curation session, keyed by their metagenotype identifier.

.+.title: Metagenotype
.+.description: A metagenotype is a composition of two genotypes, and is used as the basis for annotating multi-organism interactions.

host_genotype.title: Host genotype
host_genotype.description: The host part of the metagenotype.

pathogen_genotype.title: Pathogen genotype
pathogen_genotype.description: The pathogen part of the metagenotype.

organisms.title: Organisms
organisms.description: A collection of organisms used in the curation session, keyed by their NCBI Taxonomy identifiers.

full_name.title: Scientific name
full_name.description: The scientific (binomial) name of the species of the organism.

publications.title: Session publications
publications.description: A collection of publications curated by the curation session, keyed by their PubMed identifier.

title.title: Publication title
examples: Formate assay in body fluids: application in methanol poisoning.

publications.title: Publications
publications.description: A collection of all publications tracked by Canto, keyed by their PubMed identifier.

schema_version.title: Schema version
schema_version.description: The version number of the current schema.
